Key Arguments: The proposed ACMA powers are inconsistent with the principles of a liberal democracy.
Any restriction on free speech means that speech is not truly free.
The government has been the greatest perpetrator of misinformation and disinformation, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The legislation could lead to further suppression of free speech and extend to other areas.
Deciding what constitutes misinformation or disinformation is subjective and problematic.
Free speech should not be constrained by government fiat; the solution to disliked speech is more speech, not suppression.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech cannot be balanced against anything. It is either free or it is not.
The greatest perpetrator of misinformation and disinformation has been the government itself.
The answer to speech that is not liked is more speech, not suppression.
